org.araneaframework.uilib.support
Class BeanDisplayItem<T>

java.lang.Object
  org.araneaframework.uilib.support.DisplayItem
      org.araneaframework.uilib.support.BeanDisplayItem<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class BeanDisplayItem<T>
extends DisplayItem

Represents one item in the combo-box of the select element that is associated with an object. The object is used to resolve the label and value of this item. One can also access the associated object later through getTargetObject().

SelectControl and MultiSelectControl manage a list of them. Each item is characterized by its value and label and target object.

Since:
2.0
Author:
Martti Tamm (martti@araneaframework.org)
See Also:
Serialized Form

BeanDisplayItem

public BeanDisplayItem(T target,
                       String labelProperty,
                       String valueProperty)
Creates a new instance of DisplayItem.

Parameters:
target - The target object behind this item (required).
labelProperty - The property of target object that returns the label of this select item (required).
valueProperty - The property of target object that returns the value of this select item (required).

disabled - Whether this item is disabled.

Returns:

resolveProperty

protected static <T> String resolveProperty(T bean,
                                            String property)
Resolves the property value of given bean. The value is coerced into String.

Returns:
value of property label.

equals

public boolean equals(Object obj)
BeanDisplayItem basically uses the same equals logic because all display items need only to be compared by the value property. This method is explicitly overridden here to show that we have not forgot it.

Overrides:
equals in class DisplayItem
